Package com.github.tadukoo.util.lookandfeel.paintui

Interface PaintUIResource

All Superinterfaces:
javax.swing.plaf.UIResource
All Known Implementing Classes:
ColorPaintUIResource, Gradient.GradientUIResource
public interface PaintUIResource
extends javax.swing.plaf.UIResource

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    javax.swing.plaf.ColorUIResource getColorUIResource()
    In some cases, we need to return a ColorUIResource to support the Look & Feel properly.
    java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getMetalGradientList()
    Deprecated.
    Forever, because I hate how Metal Look and Feel does this, but I'm trying to support it all
    java.awt.Paint getPaint​(java.awt.Dimension size)
    Creates a Paint to be used based on the size of the object to be painted.

  • Method Details

    • getPaint

      java.awt.Paint getPaint​(java.awt.Dimension size)
      Creates a Paint to be used based on the size of the object to be painted. The size is given because in the case of Gradients, it determines where the points are placed.
      Parameters:
      size - The Dimensions of the object to be painted
      Returns:
      A Paint

    • getColorUIResource

      javax.swing.plaf.ColorUIResource getColorUIResource()
      In some cases, we need to return a ColorUIResource to support the Look & Feel properly. I don't like it, but it needs to be done for those Look & Feel pieces to work, and I'm trying to support all of them.
      Returns:
      A ColorUIResource

    • getMetalGradientList

      @Deprecated java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getMetalGradientList()
      Deprecated.
      Forever, because I hate how Metal Look and Feel does this, but I'm trying to support it all
      Metal Look and Feel has a trash way of handling gradients. Basically it takes 3 colors and 2 fractions, but with the 3 colors, it repeats color 1 and does 1, 2, 1, 3. The fractions represent the 2 middle points, but the 2nd point is calculated as mid1 * 2 + mid2.

      This method exists for the purpose of appeasing the Metal Look & Feel god who decided this disgusting way of code.
      Returns:
      The garbage List that Metal Look and Feel expects for gradients that matches best to the one defined here
